title: With Trump in Power, Democrats Try to Redefine Themselves as Disrupters
summary: Since President Trump’s rise, Democrats have served as defenders of a political system many Americans believe is broken. Now the party is trying a new approach.

title: Trump Says ‘Housing First’ Failed the Homeless. Here’s What the Evidence Says.
summary: The Trump administration has sought to move away from the model, which supporters call “evidence based” but opponents consider overly permissive.

title: Kennedy Center’s Christmas Eve Jazz Show Canceled After Trump Name Added to Building
summary: Chuck Redd, a jazz musician, said he canceled his annual concert after President Trump’s name was affixed to the Washington building’s facade.

title: Republicans Who Backed Afghan Visas Are Mum as Trump Halts Them
summary: After a fatal shooting, the Trump administration froze a visa program for Afghans that Republicans in Congress had championed. The G.O.P. has not objected.

title: Man Shot in ICE Confrontation in Maryland, Officials Say
summary: Federal and local officials said the man, an immigrant from Portugal, tried to flee and harm agents. He and another man were hospitalized after a vehicle they were in crashed.

title: Why Russia Is Likely to Reject the New US-Ukrainian Peace Plan
summary: The first draft essentially called for Ukraine’s surrender. The revised version includes the security guarantees Kyiv wants to prevent future Russian aggression.

title: ‘Carol of the Bells’ Once Filled the Air Here. Now It’s Only Bombs.
summary: Mykola Leontovych, the Ukrainian composer of the famed festive song, lived in the eastern city of Pokrovsk. Months of Russian assaults have erased most tributes to his life there.

title: A Million More Epstein Documents Have Been Found, Justice Dept. Says
summary: Democratic lawmakers, who had criticized the Justice Department’s release of the material, accused the Trump administration of violating the law mandating the release of the files.

title: K-Pop in 2025: What ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ and NewJeans Tell Us About the Genre
summary: The genre peaked in terms of global awareness with “KPop Demon Hunters,” while the industry’s most promising new act was mired in a legal morass.

title: Heavy Rains and Floods Threaten California on Christmas Day
summary: Much of Southern California remained at risk of potentially deadly floods on Thursday, as heavy rains showed little sign of easing through the week.

title: They Were Supposed to Protect Young Workers. Instead, They Cashed In.
summary: Profit-seekers co-opted America’s premier cultural exchange program, the J-1 visa, which brought young people to work in the United States. Some sponsors charged thousands in fees.

title: After Suffering in Israeli Prison, a Gaza Detainee Comes Home to More Pain
summary: Haitham Salem spent 11 months held by Israel without charge and said he endured beatings and abuse. He was released as part of the cease-fire deal, longing to return to his family.

title: Tesla Robotaxis Are Big on Wall St. but Lagging on Roads
summary: Shares of Tesla have hit new highs on optimism about the company’s self-driving taxis. But experts say Tesla is far behind Waymo, which has a big head start.

title: With Airspace Closed, a Lonely Christmas for Many Venezuelans
summary: The holidays usually bring home huge numbers from the Venezuelan diaspora. But this year, after international airlines halted almost all service, many people are spending Christmas alone and on edge.

title: Coquito Was Once a Puerto Rican Secret. Now Everybody Knows.
summary: The Puerto Rican rum and coconut drink used to be passed down within families, but now it has become a holiday party staple beyond the community.

title: After a Plane Crashed in the Texas Fog, 2 Stories of Rescue
summary: A plane from Mexico was on a medical mission on Monday when it crashed into Galveston Bay, and two men on the water that day helped save two lives.

title: Will Zohran Mamdani Be the 111th or the 112th Mayor of New York? It Depends.
summary: An arcane numbering system and the misplacement of an official record have caused confusion on where Zohran Mamdani falls in history.

title: He Was Locked Up in a Psych Ward. It Helped Him Get His Life Together.
summary: Lamar Brown went through a rigorous program at a New York State psychiatric hospital aimed at stopping the “revolving door” for homeless people with mental illness.

title: ‘Marty Supreme’ Review: Timothée Chalamet Sprints to the Top
summary: The actor stars as a magnetic, striving table-tennis champ in Josh Safdie’s new movie, one of the most exciting movies of the year.

title: The Ping-Pong Hustler Who Inspired ‘Marty Supreme’
summary: Volleying questions with the table tennis champ Marty Reisman, an inspiration for Timothée Chalamet’s new film, showed that he was a character in his own right.

title: Christmas Dinner Can Feel Endless. Embrace It.
summary: A long-neglected one-act from a theatrical master offers the key to enjoying your family gatherings.

title: Martin Scorsese: Rob Reiner Had Me in the Palm of His Hand
summary: “We had a natural affinity for each other,” Martin Scorsese writes of Rob Reiner.

title: Your Picks
summary: We revisit the most-read stories of 2025.

title: Winner in Arkansas Takes $1.817 Billion Powerball Jackpot
summary: A single ticket drawn Wednesday night won the second-largest U.S. lottery jackpot ever.

title: Pope Leo Surprises St. Peter’s Crowd Before Christmas Eve Mass
summary: Pope Leo XIV greeted the soggy faithful in St. Peter’s Square in both English and Italian and apologized that there wasn’t enough room in the basilica for them all.

title: ​North Korea Unveils the Completed Hull of What It Calls a Nuclear Submarine
summary: The debut followed the North’s first test of a new surface-to-air missile and the arrival of a U.S. nuclear-powered attack sub for a port call in South Korea.

title: Why China, a One-Party State, Is Backing Elections in This Country
summary: The vote in Myanmar, widely seen as a sham, is a bid for legitimacy by the military government. It is also a way for Beijing to exert its influence there.
